content.description: At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, a car is moving in the positive direction along a straight road. The graph represents the car’s velocity <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>v</mi></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi></math>. The car’s position at <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> is <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>.
content.question: Which of the following graphs could represent the acceleration <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math> of the car as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math>?

choices.label: The figure shows a graph consisting of five line segments in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “t, in seconds,” and the numbers 1 through 6, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “a, in meters per second squared,” and no values are indicated along it. The first line segment begins at the origin, and moves horizontally to the right, ending at the point with coordinates 1.5 comma 0. The second line segment begins where the first one ends, and then moves vertically downward, ending at the point with coordinates 1.5 comma negative 1. The third line segment begins where the second one ends and then moves horizontally to the right, ending at the point with coordinates 4 comma negative 1. The fourth line segment begins where the third one ends and then moves vertically upward, ending at the point with coordinates 4 comma 0. The fifth line segment begins where the fourth one ends and then moves horizontally to the right, ending at the point with coordinates 5 comma 0.
